greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Split-and-swap on 8-bit integers.
comment: Split-and-swap consists of spliting a binary word into two halves and swapping the parts over to form a new word, for example 11001010 becomes 10101100.
There are 256 terms to the sequence. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 14 2015
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..255
example: a(17)=17 because 17 is 00010001 which is invariant over the SaS rule.
results.author: _Jon Perry_, Oct 06 2012
